Download the binary of the yq tool (version 3.4.1).

Source: R/yq.R
download_yq.Rd

This function has side-effects by default, see the set_as_default argument.

download_yq(
  url = NULL,
  os = NULL,
  arch = NULL,
  yq_version = "3.4.1",
  destfile = fs::path(fs::path_home(), ".local/bin/yq"),
  set_as_default = TRUE,
  do_check = TRUE,
  ask = TRUE,
  overwrite = FALSE,
  verbose = getOption("scdrake_verbose")
)

Arguments

url

An URL from which binary will be downloaded. If NULL, it will be created from os, arch, and yq_version.
os

A character scalar specifying the current OS ("unix" or "windows"). If NULL, it will be determined from .Platform$OS.type.
arch

A character scalar specifying the current CPU architecture (32 or 64). If NULL, it will be determined from .Machine$sizeof.pointer (4 -> 32, 8 -> 64).
yq_version

A character scalar of yq tool version.
destfile

A character scalar specifying the destination file.
set_as_default

If TRUE, set options(scdrake_yq_binary = destfile).
do_check

If TRUE, functionality of the downloaded (or present) yq binary will be checked.
ask

A logical scalar: if TRUE, ask before yq binary is downloaded.
overwrite

If TRUE, overwrite the existing yq binary if exists.
verbose

A logical scalar: if TRUE, be verbose. The default value is obtained from getOption("scdrake_verbose").

Contents
